result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Thomas Rauser was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for Probation on 08/09/22 by 09:00 AM 
- 2 day credit against ultimate sentence
- Eligible for expungement upon successfully completing Probation

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

3:01 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Michael Thomas Rauser. Defendant Michael Thomas Rauser appeared by video. Court reviews case. Atty Harrelson states motion was not going to be heard today but would be entering plea and DE was allowed to appear via zoom.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to AMENDED Ct 1: Negligent Operation of a firearm- 941.20(1)(a) in 22CF211. DE sworn. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of AMENDED Ct 1in 22CF211.Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders:

S/W 1 Year Probation

- $243.00 Court Cost, payable through Probation
- $200.00 DNA Surcharge, payable through Probation
- DNA Sample

Conditions of Probation
- AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations
- Absolute Sobriety
- Testing at Agents discretion
- Not to use or possess firearms
- Complete any recommendations deemed appropriate by the Compas Assessment if agents requests

2 days credit against ultimate sentence
DE is eligible for expungement upon successfully completing Probation

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Michael Thomas Rauser appeared via zoom. Arraignment on April 29, 2022 at 10:15 am.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF212 & 22CF211 (PH)
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Aaron A. Nelson and  DF:  Elsa Adele Awsumb appeared on 22CF212. DF ATTY: Jeremiah Harrelson and DF: Michael Rauser appeared on 22CF211. Cases called at 3:15 p.m. Court notes these matters are scheduled for preliminary hearing. ADA Ellenwood calls Investigator Geisness to the Stand. S/T Dustin Geisness. Employed with the St Croix County Sheriff's Department. Direct by ADA Ellenwood. Witness identifies both defendant's in the courtroom. Record will reflect identification. Cross by Atty Nelson regarding file 22CF212. Cross by Atty Harrelson regarding file 22CF211. Redirect by ADA Ellenwood. Rebuttal by Atty Nelson. Witness excused. No further witnesses or evidence by any parties. Atty Nelson gives argument. Atty Harrelson gives argument. ADA Ellenwood gives argument. Requesting bind over. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial in both files.  Arraignment scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 10:15 am.
